frontmatter.title: CSRF
frontmatter.summary: Cross-Site Request Forgery is an attack that forces an end user to execute unwanted actions on a web application in which they are currently authenticated

frontmatter.title: CSRF
frontmatter.summary: Cross-Site Request Forgery is an attack that forces an end user to execute unwanted actions on a web application in which they are currently authenticated

frontmatter.title: Web Caching
frontmatter.summary: Caching is the term for storing reusable responses in order to make subsequent requests faster.

frontmatter.title: Content Negotiation
frontmatter.summary: Content Negotiation is a mechanism that makes it possible to serve different representations of a resource at the same URI.  HTTP 1.1 defines two main styles of Content Negotiation:  Server-driven and Agent-driven

frontmatter.title: XSS
frontmatter.summary: Cross-Site Scripting is a code injection attack that allows an attacker to execute malicious JavaScript in another user's browser.

frontmatter.title: Proxy & Reflect
frontmatter.summary: A proxy wraps another object and intercepts operations, handling them on its own, or transparently allowing the object to handle them.

frontmatter.title: Block Formatting Context
frontmatter.summary: The block formatting context is part of the visual CSS rendering of a web page. It affects the layout by changing how the contained elements float and clear.

frontmatter.title: Flex
frontmatter.summary: The Flexbox Layout module aims at providing a more efficient way to lay out, align and distribute space among items in a container, even when their size is unknown or dynamic.

frontmatter.title: Transmission Control Protocol
frontmatter.summary: The transmission control protocol (TCP) is the internet standard ensuring the successful exchange of data packets between devices over a network.

frontmatter.title: Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure
frontmatter.summary: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is an application protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems

frontmatter.title: Hypertext Transfer Protocol
frontmatter.summary: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is an application protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems

frontmatter.title: Garbage Collection
frontmatter.summary: Trash talk: the Orinoco garbage collector
